parameters.name: EndpointGroupArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group to describe.

nested_items.name: EndpointGroup
nested_items.description: The description of an endpoint group.

nested_items.name: EndpointGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the endpoint group.

nested_items.name: EndpointGroupRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the endpoint group is located.

nested_items.name: EndpointId
nested_items.description: An ID for the endpoint. If the endpoint is a Network Load Balancer or Application Load Balancer, this is the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource. If the endpoint is an Elastic IP address, this is the Elastic IP address allocation ID. For Amazon EC2 instances, this is the EC2 instance ID.

nested_items.name: Weight
nested_items.description: The weight associated with the endpoint. When you add weights to endpoints, you configure Global Accelerator to route traffic based on proportions that you specify. For example, you might specify endpoint weights of 4, 5, 5, and 6 (sum=20). The result is that 4/20 of your traffic, on average, is routed to the first endpoint, 5/20 is routed both to the second and third endpoints, and 6/20 is routed to the last endpoint. For more information, see Endpoint weights in the Global Accelerator Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: HealthState
nested_items.description: The health status of the endpoint.

nested_items.name: ClientIPPreservationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether client IP address preservation is enabled for an endpoint. The value is true or false. The default value is true for Application Load Balancers endpoints.

nested_items.name: TrafficDialPercentage
nested_items.description: The percentage of traffic to send to an Amazon Web Services Region. Additional traffic is distributed to other endpoint groups for this listener.

nested_items.name: HealthCheckPort
nested_items.description: The port that Global Accelerator uses to perform health checks on endpoints that are part of this endpoint group.

nested_items.name: HealthCheckProtocol
nested_items.description: The protocol that Global Accelerator uses to perform health checks on endpoints that are part of this endpoint group. The default value is TCP.

nested_items.name: HealthCheckPath
nested_items.description: If the protocol is HTTP/S, then this value provides the ping path that Global Accelerator uses for the destination on the endpoints for health checks. The default is slash (/).

nested_items.name: HealthCheckIntervalSeconds
nested_items.description: The time--10 seconds or 30 seconds--between health checks for each endpoint. The default value is 30.

nested_items.name: ThresholdCount
nested_items.description: The number of consecutive health checks required to set the state of a healthy endpoint to unhealthy, or to set an unhealthy endpoint to healthy. The default value is 3.

nested_items.name: PortOverrides
nested_items.description: Allows you to override the destination ports used to route traffic to an endpoint. Using a port override lets you map a list of external destination ports (that your users send traffic to) to a list of internal destination ports that you want an application endpoint to receive traffic on.

nested_items.name: ListenerPort
nested_items.description: The listener port that you want to map to a specific endpoint port. This is the port that user traffic arrives to the Global Accelerator on.

nested_items.name: EndpointPort
nested_items.description: The endpoint port that you want a listener port to be mapped to. This is the port on the endpoint, such as the Application Load Balancer or Amazon EC2 instance.
